section.title: schemagen Overview
section.para: The current schema generator can process either Java source files or class files.
We also provide an Ant task to run the schema generator - see the instructions for .

section.title: Launching schemagen
section.para: The schema generator can be launched using the appropriate schemagen shell script in the bin directory for your platform.

If your java sources/classes reference other classes, they must be accessable on your system CLASSPATH environment variable, or they need to be given to the tool by using the -classpath/ -cp options. Otherwise you will see errors when generating your schema.

listitem.programlisting: % path/to/jaxb/bin/schemagen.sh Foo.java Bar.java ... Note: Writing schema1.xsd
> path\to\jaxb\bin\schemagen.bat Foo.java Bar.java ... Note: Writing schema1.xsd

informalexample.programlisting:
Usage: schemagen [-options ...] <java files>
Options: -d <path> : Specify where to place processor and javac generated class files -cp <path> : Specify where to find user specified files -classpath <path> : Specify where to find user specified files -episode <file> : generate episode file for separate compilation -version : display version information -help : Display this usage message

listitem.para: Generates the "episode file", which is really just a JAXB customization file (but with vendor extensions specific to the JAXB RI, as of 2.1.) When people develop additional schemas that depend on what this schemagen invocation produces, they can use this episode file to have their generated code refer to your classes.

section.title: Generated Resource Files
section.para: The current schema generator simply creates a schema file for each namespace referenced in your Java classes. There is no way to control the name of the generated schema files at this time. Use for that purpose.
